Package seng202.team5.service

Class AirportService

java.lang.Object
seng202.team5.service.AirportService
All Implemented Interfaces:
Service
public class AirportService
extends java.lang.Object
implements Service
AirportService Contains the functions save, update, delete, getData, and validity check functions for airports that interact with Accessors. Implements the Service interface.

  • Constructor Details

    • AirportService

      public AirportService()
      Constructor for AirportService. Creates an AirportAccessor and sets the valid DSTs.

  • Method Details

    • save

      public int save​(java.lang.String name, java.lang.String city, java.lang.String country, java.lang.String iata, java.lang.String icao, double latitude, double longitude, int altitude, float timezone, java.lang.String dst, java.lang.String tz)
      Checks the validity of input parameters and then passes them into the save method of the AirportAccessor as an ArrayList.
      Parameters:
      name - The name of the airport, cannot be null.
      city - The city of the airport, cannot be null.
      country - The country of the airport, cannot be null.
      iata - The 3-letter IATA code of the airport, must be unique, may be null if not known/assigned.
      icao - The 4-letter ICAO code of the airport, must be unique, may be null if not known/assigned.
      latitude - The latitude of the airport, a double. Negative is South, positive is North, cannot be null.
      longitude - The longitude of the airport, a double. Negative is West, positive is East, cannot be null.
      altitude - The altitude of the airport in feet, an integer. Cannot be null.
      timezone - The hours offset from UTC, a float, cannot be null.
      dst - The daylight savings time of the airport, one of E (Europe), A (US/Canada), S (South America), O (Australia), Z (New Zealand), N (None) or U (Unknown), cannot be null.
      tz - Timezone in "tz" (Olson) format, i.e. Country/Region. Cannot be null.
      Returns:
      int result The airport_id of the airport that was just created by the AirportAccessor.

    • update

      public int update​(int id, java.lang.String newName, java.lang.String newCity, java.lang.String newCountry, java.lang.String newIATA, java.lang.String newICAO, java.lang.Double newLatitude, java.lang.Double newLongitude, java.lang.Integer newAltitude, java.lang.Float newTimezone, java.lang.String newDST, java.lang.String newTZ) throws java.sql.SQLException
      Checks the validity of input parameters and then passes them into the update method of the AirportAccessor.
      Parameters:
      id - The airport_id of the given airport you want to update.
      newName - The new name of the airport, may be null if not to be updated.
      newCity - The new city of the airport, may be null if not to be updated.
      newCountry - The new country of the airport, may be null if not to be updated.
      newIATA - The new 3-letter IATA code of the airport, may be null if not to be updated.
      newICAO - The new 4-letter ICAO code of the airport, may be null if not to be updated.
      newLatitude - The new latitude of the airport, a double. Negative is South and positive is North. May be null if not to be updated.
      newLongitude - The new longitude of the airport, a double. Negative is West and positive is East. May be null if not to be updated.
      newAltitude - The new altitude of the airport in feet, an integer. May be null if not to be updated.
      newTimezone - The new timezone of the airport, hours offset from UTC. A float, may be null if not to be updated.
      newDST - The new dst of the airport, one of E (Europe), A (US/Canada), S (South America), O (Australia), Z (New Zealand), N (None) or U (Unknown). May be null if not to be updated.
      newTZ - The new tz_database_timezone of the airport, timezone in "tz" (Olson) format. May be null if not to be updated.
      Returns:
      int result The airport_id of the airport that was just updated by the AirportAccessor.
      Throws:
      java.sql.SQLException

    • delete

      public boolean delete​(int id)
      Checks if the airport to be deleted exists, and if it does then passes the airport_id into the delete method of AirportAccessor.
      Specified by:
      delete in interface Service
      Parameters:
      id - The airport_id of the airport to be deleted.
      Returns:
      boolean result True if the delete operation is successful, False otherwise.

    • getData

      public java.sql.ResultSet getData​(java.lang.String name, java.lang.String city, java.lang.String country)
      Retrieves all airports with the given parameters.
      Parameters:
      name - string containing the airport name.
      city - string containing a city.
      country - string containing a country.
      Returns:
      ResultSet of airports.

    • dataExists

      public boolean dataExists​(java.lang.String code)
      Checks if an airport exists with the given IATA/ICAO code.
      Parameters:
      code - An airport IATA/ICAO code.
      Returns:
      boolean True if the airport exists, false otherwise.

    • iataIsValid

      public boolean iataIsValid​(java.lang.String iata)
      Checks that a given airport IATA code is valid. IATA code must either be null or not exist in the database to be valid.
      Parameters:
      iata - An airport IATA code.
      Returns:
      boolean True if the IATA code is valid, False otherwise.

    • icaoIsValid

      public boolean icaoIsValid​(java.lang.String icao)
      Checks that a given airport ICAO code is valid. ICAO code must either be null or not exist in the database to be valid.
      Parameters:
      icao - An airport ICAO code.
      Returns:
      boolean True if the ICAO code is valid, False otherwise.

    • getMaxID

      public int getMaxID()
      Calls the getMaxID method of the AirportAccessor to get the maximum airport_id contained in the database.
      Returns:
      int The maximum airport_id contained in the database.

    • updateRoutes

      public void updateRoutes​(java.lang.String newCode, java.lang.String oldCode) throws java.sql.SQLException
      Updates any routes that contain the old airport IATA/ICAO code with the new code.
      Parameters:
      newCode - String, new airport IATA/ICAO code.
      oldCode - String, old airport IATA/ICAO code.
      Throws:
      java.sql.SQLException - Caused by the ResultSet interactions
